quote: I pulled on my BaseCamp race kit, the green and gray explore kit, a favorite of Tim Cusick. That thought brought a smile. Finished by slipping on the bright yellow race socks. Yep. Could not be better... For me it was the classic tale of two cities. The best of days, the not best of days.

So proud of our BaseCamp crew! There are a lot of medals in the house tonight!! Tracy wins the age group and Nancy takes third! Amy takes second in the long haul age group and Allie wins the Athena category for the long haul! Ken, John and I all put in respectable efforts! It was and a blast! Having...
I went to Michigan with Allie Pope Burger to meet up with Tracy, Nancy, Beth, and Ken to race in the Cow Pie Classic gravel race. It was a great weekend of good people and great racing!
[He] flew off the line with a serious mission and 300 plus watts
Both/all/crashes. Ugh. Its okay, once I decided the race was over and I should just enjoy the ride, I stopped at every aid station to drink beer and fireball with the volunteers and it was amazing.
Weather was about perfect, and the course was fast. There was way more single track this year than previous years, some of it was tight and twisty but overall very smooth and nothing technical.

You can obviously, but it's not the ideal tire, you won't be competitive and you'll lose any group you're in during certain sections. You don't need extra speed on the flats and pavement, you need to make it through key sections and still be with the group or you'll be chasing...

It had a lot more single track this year. If this the theme going forward, along with the most likely poor conditions, a gravel bike is not it especially slicks. Again, you can finish the race, but you won't be competing. This is the worst race of the 3 for slicks.

Slicks are fine until you go off road into the farms. You will get dropped for sure. There are MTB sections and some very sketchy downhills. I race Cat 1 XCO and MTB 100s and I thought Cow Pie had some scary off road sections.
Weather was about perfect, and the course was fast... picture perfect weather
Race day. Cool and perfect. A quiet awaking... Finished by slipping on... the bright yellow race socks. Yep. Could not be better... under a perfect blue sky morning
The Long Haul will share the short haul route until 3 miles past Woodard lake where you make a break north and go past a cool long haul only farm.

aptly named after 'the worlds most dangerous bull'. the bodacious century is 105 miles of the best gravel around the Grand and maple river. tons of tree covered hardpacked roads with private property sections scattered in at 6.5, 85 and 92 mile marks.
It was fun to ride but hard to pass from wave 12 and the pace took a large hit in the middle of the course.

riders will have the option to sign up for the Free range flyers wave or the finishers wave. this is different from previous years where we had elite and sport. the Finisher waves will get a participation medal for your race and we are excited to celebrate your accomplishment with you.
Both/all/crashes. Ugh.

Dinner that evening was a joyful affair. Everyone brought something delicious to the table. I could only wish every pre-race meal was this nourishing for both body and soul. John sent us to our dreams with several songs relaxing our pre-race thoughts...

I feel so very fortunate to have been a part of this group! Time spent together was priceless. The support limitless! Laughs, race stories, life stories, great food and snacksâ€¦..oh how we have all bonded through Basecamp! I am still on a Cowpie weekend buzz!

The 8th Annual Cow Pie Classic is more than a bike race, but it is one heck of a race!... #RIDECOWPIE will leave you with a smile ear to ear whether you want to come out and push your limits with Michigan gravel race series riders or join family and friends to pose for that perfect farmland pic from...
Big news for 2026 is our moved starting line into ionia's social district. a social district is an outdoor public area where people can purchase an alcoholic beverage and walk with it outside.
FREE TENT CAMPING AVAILABLE ON A FIRST COME FIRST SERVE BASIS
we put at least 50 volunteers on course! 10 policed intersections. three AID STATIONS ON COURSE. THIS IS AN OPEN COURSE PLEASE GIVE VEHICLES THEIR SPACE AND STAY ON YOUR SIDE OF THE ROAD
Huge thanks to brad from clear2aviate for doing a flyover FOR OUR national anthem!
all awards will be held ACROSS FROM STEELE STREET HALL we hope you join us to celebrate every finisher
